node.title: Mitchell's batting heroics powers New Zealand into final with win over England
node.content: ["Daryl Mitchell and Jimmy Neesham have smashed New Zealand into the T20 World Cup final with a violent late-over batting display in the semi-final win over England at Abu Dhabi.", "Winning the toss and bowling first, the Blackcaps were on the back foot early as England's opening pair of Jos Buttler and Jonny Bairstow added 37 runs in the first five overs.", "That momentum was ended by Adam Milne, who dismissed Bairstow with his first delivery, as a Kane Williamson catch sent the English opener on his way for 13.", "Bairstow's exit meant Dawid Malan's arrival at the crease, where the left-hander was given an early life with his score on 10, as Devon Conway shelled a regulation catch behind the stumps.", "After moving past Pakistan captain Babar Azam as the tournament's leading run scorer so far, Buttler fell lbw to Ish Sodhi, out trying to reverse sweep the leg spinner - as his exit saw Moeen Ali join Malan.Making the most of his early life, Malan unleashed a series of cover drives - both lofted and along the ground - as he and Moeen combined to hurt the Blackcaps through the middle overs.", "Promoted up the order to No. 4 in the batting order, Moeen added 63 from 43 balls in partnership with Malan (41), on his way to 51 not out, the standout score of England's 166/4.", "Moeen hit three fours and two sixes in his knock, as England scored 99 runs in the final 10 overs of their innings.", "Jimmy Neesham finished as the pick of the Blackcaps' bowlers, taking 1/18, as Tim Southee (1/24)In response, the Blackcaps' start was rocked when Martin Guptill fell to the third ball of the innings, as he spooned Chris Woakes to Moeen at mid-on at 4/1.", "Williamson came and went for five, as pressure from Woakes told when the Kiwi captain scooped the ball straight to Adil Rashid, leaving the Blackcaps in trouble at 13/2.", "More to come"]
